project1.title: Pinterest Look-Alike
project1.description: Users curate a collection of pins organized onto boards, similar to the real Pinterest.

project2.title: Joke Generator
project2.description: This application will give you a good chuckle. Using an external API, I used react to dynamically update elements on the DOM.
project2.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, External API

project3.title: Le Baguette
project3.description: This web application allows authorized users to use CRUD functionality to manage a restaurant's operations. This group project was completed during my program at Nashville Software School.

project4.title: Renaissance Fair
project4.description: Users can manage all aspects of designing a Renaissance Fair. On this NSS group project, the majority of my work was on the single events view.

project5.title: Dino Kennel
project5.description: This is a single-page application with dynamic features. Similar to Tamagotchi digital pets, the user can care for dinos in the kennel by feeding them, petting them, and sending them on adventures!

project6.title: Snoopy Chat
project6.description: In this NSS group project, we built a chat application with a Snoopy theme and all CRUD functionality.
project6.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github

project7.title: Tamagotchi
project7.description: Similar to the original Tamagotchi, the user can perform actions to care for a Tamagotchi pet.

project8.title: Pet Adoption
project8.description: The site shows available pet information on individual cards and the user can filter available pets by type.
project8.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Version Control with Github

project9.title: Sorting Hat
project9.description: The user enters a student name and a card is generated with the name entered and a random assignment to one of the four Hogwarts Houses.
